Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, awful Restaurant Service -- Eat Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq501
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of friends for a night before leaving for Dominican. We were happy with our room; it was very nice and spacious and we got a Holidome room which meant easy access to the pool. Check in was relatively fast and the staff was friendly; however, when we arrived we found out that shuttles were already booked up for the following morning, which meant we had to now pay for our transportation to the airport. This was very inconvenient, as the hotel advertises its free shuttle service; it doesn't mention , however, that there are only 6 spots on each shuttle and if you don't sign up in advance you'll be stuck taking a taxi or else you will miss your flight! In addition to this, it was a long ride up for us and we were hungry. So, we decided to eat at the restaurant right in the hotel. Bad choice! At first glance, the prices are reasonable so I was convinced we had made a good choice. However, now I wish I would not have eaten there! The service was very slow. The hostess told us it was a busy night in the restaurant (there were only about 5 tables full out of 20, so we were confused), she said a lot of the tables hadnâ€™t been cleaned up yet (so why weren't they cleaning them?), but she said she would still seat us. Our server was awful! He had no idea what he was doing; he brought us the wrong orders, and was not very knowledgeable. He was supposed to bring us bread and buns before our meal, but forgot to. I asked for a drink and had to remind him twice, because he kept forgetting to bring it over. I had a coupon for a free glass of wine or beer for being a Priority Club Rewards Member, and the server didn't tell me until the end that the wine I had ordered didn't count on the coupon because it had to be house wine... I don't know why he didn't tell me that when I showed him the card at the beginning of my order (that made me very mad)!! My friend got the ceaser salad and it literally smelt like stinky feet so she couldn't eat it. So all in all, we ended up paying more than we had planned, for a meal that was not all that great, and for service that was unprofessional and unfriendly. If you stay at this hotel, don't go to the restaurant! It is a waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed for an overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: susan2305
Reviews.Content: Due to flight delays we missed our connection and had to stay overnight near the airport. The airline gave us a number to call for a delayed trip discount and we got a very good rate. The free shuttle arrived within 10 minutes of our call (it was posssibly already on the way as there was another customer wating). There are a number of Holiday Inns near the airport, so make sure you know which one you are going to. Check in was smooth and fast. We called reception to ask for some additional coffee and sugar and it was deliverd to our room within minutes. The room was typical Holiday Inn - large, clean and well equipped. The bathroom had a new top of the counter sink which was at odds with the holes in the tile floor and the discoloured grout. This is the only time I have encountered such a problem at a Holiday Inn, and the manager seemed quite surprised when I mentioned it at checkout. It was not serious enough for us to bother changing rooms, but it took away from the overall quality of the accommodation. The hotel features an indoor pool courtyard which could be quite noisy if your room overlooked the atrium. There were lots of children playing in the pool. The restaurant is also right there, and the whole area was noisy and smelled strongly of chlorine. Our room was well removed from the pool and very quiet although it is a long walk from reception. We booked the airport shuttle for 6:25am and it left right on time. We had asked for a wakeup call, which came on time, and we also got a followup call about 15 minutes before the shuttle left. We were looking for a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel with efficient, complimetary airport service and that is exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: supergirlteacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed there before flying to Mexico a few weeks ago. We got the overnight accommodation/parking "deal"....which was $175.00. Check in was relatively quick but check out was disorganized and took awhile. Room was ok....clean enough but bed was uncomfortable and we were put on the edge of the Courtyard so the light shining through the supposed blackout drapes was really bright and made it hard to sleep. We flew out very early in the am and they didn't give us the wake up call we'd asked for....luckily we'd set our phone alarms or I would have been even less happy! I'd originally booked this hotel because the pool looked really nice so we were hoping for a swim/hot tub to help us sleep before our trip....we go there and the pool was super tiny and in a pit in the middle of the Courtyard....so people eating dinner could see down into the pool area. Needless to say we didn't use it. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant....food was ok but pricey and service was SUPER slow! But, after we had FINALLY found the place and parked our car in the long term parking which was FAR from the door and hard to get out of, we didn't want to leave again. All in all, this hotel is OK...but there are many others which are closer to the airport and are much nicer and less expensive. For being an "Airport Hotel", it's actually nowhere near the airport. I definitely don't feel like I got great value for what I paid. I had paid the little extra because of the pool and how nice the hotel looked online.....definitely some creative photography there!

Reviews.Title: “Vehicle theft is common here”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBugger
Reviews.Content: After making a reservation to stay here, I called back to be sure the parking was secure, as I was paying to leave my car there while on vacation. I was assured that the parking lot was secure with a gate, camaras and a fence. Upon arriving, we found the "secure" gate had the code to enter the parking lot on a sign at the gate. Since it was too late to return our vehicle two hours back home, we left it. We came back one week later to find it had been stolen. The front desk staff was of no help, nor were they surprised!! In fact the response given to my husband was "well sir, that type of vehicle is not safe to leave in Montreal" Not only were we not offered an apology, rooms for the night were going to be offered to us at a "discounted" rate and we were not reimbursed the fee we paid for parking. After one hour and forty five minutes when the police came, my husband explained to them where in the parking lot our car had been parked. The officer replied with "oh, near door seven?" He had done this many times before. Upon returning home, we have found a number of people to have had their cars stolen from the same place. In fact, our insurance adjusters last claim was from this hotel!! Although a vehicle is a material item that can be replaced, we left with an unsettling feeling that this hotel, or front desk staff at the very least, has played a continuing part in these thefts!!

Reviews.Title: “Vehicle Stolen”
Reviews.Author: RandyP331
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Picking up my friends at this Hotel after they returned from vacation and found that their vehicle was stolen. Front desk was no help, did not seem shocked. My freinds had called first to see if it was safe to leave a vehicle and was told yes, we have camera's. Police took 1 hour and 20 minutes to respond and again no surprise to them. The Hotel offered my friends a DISCOUNT on a room for the night! Beware if you are staying at this Hotel as car theft seems to be an accepted practice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service sometimes.”
Reviews.Author: mama_2_a_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Family day Weekend. Drove 12 hours to stay at a mediocre hotel at best. The first night after talking to the front desk about the noise level I had to go out and tell the kids running up and down the hall to go to thier own rooms that people were trying to sleep. It was after 1am and had been going on since 10pm. The pool looked great until we got in and it was so cold, not to mention the scuba divers that we had to avoid. The beds were comfy and clean but the bathroom was in serious need of an upgrade, I'm used to being able to bath my kids in a tub but I wouldn't dare this weekend. Spend the extra money stay in a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: thon
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel to stay in between flights for a Caribbean vacation. Because of weather, our flight into Montreal was 4 hours late. By the time we checked into the hotel, the free shuttle bus was fully reserved for our early morning departure so we had to pay for a taxi back to the airport. Not the hotelâ€™s fault though â€“ they canâ€™t control the weather. Check in and check out was fairly quick and efficient. Front desk staff were helpful. Because of our late arrival (after midnight) and early departure (4:30 a.m.) we did not use any of the hotel facilities. However, I will comment on the room itself. The room â€“ what can I say, other than I will not stay here again. The room itself was fine â€“ typical Holiday Inn room I suppose. But the location! Many of the rooms look into the inner courtyard, or atrium so no window to the outside. Window opens into the interior courtyard so everyone walking by can look directly into your room unless the curtains are firmly closed all the time. Fortunately we had some paper clips to use as the curtains did not close completely. And, there is an indoor swimming pool in the atrium/courtyard so the smell of chlorine in our room was very strong. Never stayed in a hotel anywhere in the world that didnâ€™t have a window to the outside.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby smells like a closed in swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: JulieFermont
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this hotel after Air Canada changed our flight coming back from Miami. As soon as we walked in to the lobby we noticed a watery smell. Very unpleasant. They have a large indoor pool area with the opening just off the lobby. It smelled a mix of chlorine and humidity. Thankfully our room smelled ok. The beds were confortable, the room clean but that was it. I will not go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lori C
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we had ever stayed at a Holiday Inn, and by far this place is the scum of the earth they shouldn't even call it Holiday Inn. check in was slow, the girl who checked us in couldn't even reach the counter, her vest was not buttoned properly, not a pretty sight. the room smelled like smoke, the food was horrible, my husband even got sick, at night we couldn't sleep so we decided to take a walk in their so called atrium and saw a mouse passing us by ,oh my god!!!, that was it for us we went back to our room slept on top of the bed with no covers, at this point we just wanted the morning to come quick so we can get out of this hell hole they call the Holiday Inn, do your homework before booking near the airport in Montreal apparently there are maybe 2 or 3 hotels that are decent in this area.

Reviews.Title: “great for family”
Reviews.Author: gogu2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, 2011 aug and 2012 Feb. Back in 2011 there was quite a bit of work being done to the hotel, hallways were locked out, hard to move around. In Feb 2012, the construction crew seemed to have finished up and the property looks great! We had a large King suite (2157), with a view of the indoor pool and also a balcony to inner court (outside). Great for a smoker in a no-smoking room. Pool and game tables were great for the kids! Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sensfan12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Montreal airport. It has a huge indoor atrium area with a pool and games room. It also has a nice bar area with a few televisions and a restaurant (didn't eat there). Our room was quite nice with a king size bed, small fridge, large bathroom, free WiFi. The room was very clean and the bed quite comfortable. We also received very good service when checking in. The location of the hotel leaves alot to be desired - there is only a bus stop in front of it, no subway station, no nearby restaurants or stores. You basically have to drive to get anywhere from the hotel. In addition, they offer a shuttle to the airport and let customers park their cars there during their trips. They don't seem to manage the number of cars in their lot so it was absolutely jam packed - we had to park completely on the other side of the hotel on Saturday night. Having so many cars parked long term also prevents them from clearing the snow from the lot. We were there in early Feb - it was an absolute mess - about 6 inches of bumpy ice everywhere! Very dangerous! The other thing to look out for is that our room was facing the atrium / pool area so it was very noisy during the day. It didn't bother us because we only got back to the room at 10:30pm at which time the pool was closed. But if you need to rest during the day, it could be an issue. Overall, this hotel is ideal for families (because of the atrium area), sports teams, or for people flying out of the Montreal airport. If you're looking for a romantic getaway or doing the tourist thing, then you should probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DownEastNewbie
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful.The room was quiet,with comfy bed,and pleasing to the eye.I enjoyed the pool daily.Parking was a little tight,but there always seemed to be someone leaving as we were entering.Our room was spotlessly clean.The restaurant was hit or miss on our two nights dinning in.The fried calamari is excellent,but not impressed with the dumplings,Enjoyed steak dinner but let down on the scallop and shrimp.Club sand.& fries good too.The breakfast was half and half:Cold breakfast with fresh fruits and pastries was really good, not so good was hot breakfast;greasy sausage(should put on a rack to stay out of grease) blah eggs,beans tasted straight from the can.But you can have a really good breakfast if you watch your selections.Waitstaff is friendly and helpful.It's great to sit at the atrium tables by the pool in a bright tropical setting;Especially in the coldest period of Winter.All in all we had a wonderful stay and it will be our #1 pick in Montreal.Almost a perfect stay.And there is no such thing as perfect.We will be back.Thank you for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gucci85
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the night before leaving on a trip. I took the shuttle service and left the car at the hotel while I was away on my trip. Make sure to book the shuttle as soon as you check-in because they only take a certain amount of passenger. My room was very spacious, clean and comfortable. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: Positive: 1) Near my husband client office 2) Free internet and airport shuttle 3) we love the food and ambience of the restaurant(near the indoor pool) 4) has a free business centre 5) nice room with full amenities Negative: 1) Toilet floor was sticky(not properly cleaned) 2) Hotel driveway was so icy(snow was not shovelled) and no salt(slippery)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good for families.”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Pierre D
Reviews.Content: As I live 2 hours away from the airport I often stay at an airport hotel if I have a morning flight, especially in winter due to bad driving conditions. As a result I had the chance to try a few. Usually one has limited expectations for such hotels: clean rooms, quiet, free shuttle to the airport and wi-fi (free preferably). This hotel has all of these. But it also has more. I found the restaurant slightly above average for this type of hotel. It also has recreational facilities (swimming pool and various games) which makes it a unique family destination. Keeping the kids busy inside in an otherwise boring airport hotel is a big plus for families.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: chaton2411
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel by Air Canada due to a schedule change. Next time, I will just pay to go to Marriott at the Airport! Air Canada booked around 20-25 passengers to this hotel, plus passengers already booked here. The shuttle admits around 20, no more, so it was a battle to get on board, and it was -20 that night. It wasn't a surprise for them to have that many guests coming, the shuttle should have been arranged in consequence. The room was small, there were hairs in the tub, and on the walls....Grimme in the corners of the bathroom, just disgusting. Beds were comfortable, for the little sleep we were able to get. Rooms are connecting, so we got there at 1am just to hear the next doors kids vrying for about an hour. Not is fault, but walls are paper thin. It looks like this hotel got stucked in the 1980's I must say that we got an awesome service at the restaurant for breakfast, and it was good too. But all in all, I'll never go again, even for free!

Reviews.Title: “poor room and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: gioraba
Reviews.Content: i took a room for a day use after a long flight to get some sleep and i found nice stuff but a very poor room quit far from the reception and because of restorations in the facilities of the hotel it was very hard for me to get any sleep hours... plus, the room was very small and the sink was outside the bathroom... i am sorry but i don't have anything good to say

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wkelly67
Reviews.Content: We stay at lot of Holiday Inns because of my husband's business travels. This hotel is one of the nicest hotels. Nicely refurbished. We did not hear much airport noise. Also one of nicest free breakfast and has a very large dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: I had a few problems when I first arrived but the staff went out of their way to sort things out for me, showing great customer service. Many thanks to Magda, Heurig and Terri. There are some bad reviews for this hotel but I was here for a month and I had a great stay. I was upgraded to a suite which was newly refurbished, clean, comfortable with a great shower. The room was cleaned daily and I was called each week by various members of staff to ensure everything was OK. There were some minor renovations still going on but didn`t inconvenience me in any way. During my stay the newly refurbished gym/sauna area was opened, which was very well equiped, and the newly refurbished restaurant was opened which was very nice, with good food. It`s not a new Hotel like some along that road, but they have carried out a lot of modernisation and refurbishment. The holidome, with the indoor pool and many plants gives it a nice atmosphere and made for a pleasant stay. Easy check in/out, no problems with the shuttle service, good customer service, would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “absolute great welcome”
Reviews.Author: john d
Reviews.Content: on arrival people at front desk were absolute great, big smile, welcome to holiday inn, they even called me back after check inn to find out in If was doing well, plus they gave me free internet access and they offert me the free transportation to airport;;;; room was nice and very clean, during my two nights stay i was always called by my name, good job, despite some renovation hotel is a very good three stars

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT O
Reviews.Content: When I arrived they originally had me in a handicap room. The person at the front desk (Magda) was able to correct the problem and upgraded me to a very nice suite. She also made sure that I had everything that was needed including the proper internet access for my three devices. This was my best experience in the years that I have stayed at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Like!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeMC79
Reviews.Content: Great service! We were upgraded to a suite when we arrived. Great location! renovations going on but it wasn't a problem. Would definitely recommend this, and I already have!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: DB1988
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the bad reviews. If you check carefully, these dreadful evaluations seem to be from people making their first trip outside of their parent's basement in Peoria. Montreal was almost completely sold out so I booked this hotel on the airport strip. I was also looking for a hotel to leave my car at this winter when I take a trip south. My first impressions upon entering the lobby was Sasha's 100,000 watt smile from the reception desk. She quickly processed our reservation and gave us the password for the free wireless internet. Our room was newly renovated with the best two double beds I've experienced outside of a super luxury hotel. The sheets are wonderfully soft too. The room came with a coffee maker â€“ terrible coffee â€“ a fridge and a microwave oven. There were plenty of reading lights, which are important and the wireless internet is very fast. The shower and shower head with plenty of pressure is one of the best I've experienced in 40 years of travelling and there was plenty of hot water. Our room was quiet without any road noise or noise from the airport. The staff at this hotel seem to be very friendly and welcoming. I complimented the manager on how much we were enjoying our stay and on the calibre of his staff. When I requested an extension of our checkout time it was granted with a smile. Parking is free and I understand that there is a parking deal for snowbirds heading south. The hotel is undergoing renovations but this activity in no way interfered with our visit. This isn't a glamourous hotel but it is solidly built and comfortable. The price, which I'm sure reflects the fact that the hotel is being redone was very reasonable. The exit experience was as wonderful as our arrival. The reception desk person, from Moldova, was efficient, friendly and professional, with a great sense of humour.

Reviews.Title: “A fun time”
Reviews.Author: Martin A
Reviews.Content: My familly and i went to the Holiday Inn aeroport for a little week-end getaway and we had a really good time. The kids enjoyed the warm pool and the ping-pong table. Service wand food were both good! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay good value”
Reviews.Author: timothyprince
Reviews.Content: stayed with my office co worker and pleasantly surpirsed despite some bad reviews: chek inn was welcomed very nicely and firendly staff. few minutwes after check inn I get a call from staff to see if we were happy about room: pool area was tremendous, but was not ready to get wet : restaurant was still under renovation: but de hell with it , had a great stay , the bar was open. timothy prince

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Anil29
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for a Hotel, near the airport and also near the heart of the city, but in a quite location. Good sleep value, nice breakfast on the house and airport pick up and drop. The rooms are cosy and the bathrooms are spacious and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “confortable stay”
Reviews.Author: john t
Reviews.Content: place was still on renovation but front desk staff made me feel home and great service room was nice and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: joseph w
Reviews.Content: great place to stay, once renovation over , no hesitation, and dont forget call Benjamin the manager he will make you fell home and is a funny men, give them a chance

Reviews.Title: “OK But wait till renovations are done. Parking lot security was poor.”
Reviews.Author: CT_Traveler_Sport
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing a major renovation. There is debris in unused hall ways and it smells of drying paint. Many rooms and amenities were not available. I suppose it will be OK in a few months or whenever the work is completed.. My room was OK though I thought the full length mirror facing the toilet was a bit disconcerting. Parking is another matter. I left my vehicle for a week in what was supposedly a secure parking lot (and paid for it as well). When I returned it had been vandalized ("keyed") with deep scratches along one side of it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: Seanatis
Reviews.Content: Our first room had hair in the bed and under the sheets. We weren't upgraded even though I was a platinum member. After our first complaint, we got upgraded to a suite and to our surprise the room hadn't been cleaned; bed was a mess and same thing for the washroom. We then were given a third room once the manager on duty had checked it out. Third time was a charm. The manager calls the room later to offer us a free breakfast. I then tried to deal for a free room but I guess because I booked with points and "it didn't cost me anything to stay there", the manager's words, he the offered me 5000 points. What a scam/disappointment. Will never recommend to anyone as they don't honor the priority club code.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in 911”
Reviews.Author: D2theWest
Reviews.Content: What a shame that it is not more obvious that the entire hotel is under renovation. And by renovation, I mean that the pool area is covered in plastic, hallways are littered with drywall dust, construction equipment noise during the day into early evening. I had to keep moving rooms. Thankfully, the staff was generous in providing me an upgraded room, after 2 attempts to find a quite room. Seriously would AVOID this hotel at all costs until the renovation is completed. Do not stay here while it is still underway, it is honestly a disaster area. I felt like I was at ground zero with the dust and debris. Not worth the money whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, needs update”
Reviews.Author: NLSusie
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, catching a flight the next morning, but couldn't sleep as we were on the highway side of the hotel. The room needed updating especially the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “worst place I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mandy155019
Reviews.Content: we are not a rich family and usually stay in economy hotels. This was the worst ever. Filthy, smelly, the carpet was wet, we couldnt get clean towels, the water park that they were advertising as opening Aug 1st was a pile of dirt and no building had been started, very disappointing for my son. The other pool was very small and very full of people. Everything seemed broken and dingy. The staff were ok, the waiter was nice. there was a whole bus load of people whole screamed and shouted till 4am!

Reviews.Title: “Better Off to Sleep on chair at the airport.... This is NO 4 star hotel as it claims to be.”
Reviews.Author: CDN_Woman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were provided with free reservations by Air France to this hotel after missing our connecting flight home. Took shuttle bus to hotel at midnight. Upon arrival to hotel, we were greeted with a front desk clerk who provided NO customer service. Noted hotel was very dirty upon arrival. Carpets were stained heavily.... walls dirty and banged up. Given incorrect directions to room.... many corridor doors locked. Arrived at room with help of one employee who cared to provide us with assistance. Upon immediate arrival to room.... I checked for bedbugs and found bed bugs to be PRESENT on mattress under sheets. Immediately left room with all our belongings through the first exit outside. We walked around the hotel from the outside in order to get back to the front desk. My husband kept on eye on our luggage outside as I went inside to request the shuttle bus back to the airport. Front desk clerk did not react or seem surprised to the discovery of bedbugs. We were offered a different room to which I immediately declined. We instead insisted on having the shuttle bus pick us back up and take us back to the airport so we can spend the night sleeping on chairs. We were told by the front desk clerk that the shuttle would arrive within 10 minutes .... ended up waiting 45 mintues outside for shuttle bus to arrive. This hotel is NOT a four star hotel as it claims to be. Bedbugs present....filthy conditions. Many corridor doors are locked which serves as a fire hazzard to guests. DO NOT stay at this hotel unless you want to comprise your health and safety. Even if an airline offers to pay for the hotel reservations, you are better off sleeping on a chair or on the floor at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “I guess it could've been alot worse!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HockeyCoachAl
Reviews.Content: Let's start off with the back door is never locked and the workers use that exit for thier smoke breaks. We stayed 7 nights and the pool was down 3 days and the other 2 days the pool was ice cold after having to be refilled after draining from high bacteria. My son got pink eye from that pool. So we chose this hotel for the pool and we were able to use it 3 times. Then on our second night we were surronded by teen-agers in every room in our hall way that they considered their living room and hung out well after midnight. I compliained to front desk and it took 15 minutes for secuity to show up. By then I had take it upon myself at 12:30 am to reprimand these kids and thier chaperones about other guests that are sleeping. Also there were some networking confrence too and the guests were also drinking in the hallways throughout the night. I was'nt bothered by this because it was'nt down my hallway. But where is security?So finally my last 3 nights were peacefull but by then the pool was closed. Also the room doors slam when exit your room and can be heard af far as 3 rooms down. So if you have busy neibhors you will always hear them entering and exiting. The hotel is also under construction and the out door pool is gone. If I had'nt prepaid this room I would've left with my family. But next year I will stay somewhere else it not worth the hassle. I always thought Holiday INN's were respectable but this experience was terrible. One final thing as you enter the hotel they have plauqes that say 4star diamond hotel. I laughed as I checked out. David Rosenberg and his Rosdev hotel group should be dissapointed in the way they manage thier hotels! BTW I'm not going to stay next door at crown plaza if this is how Rosdev runs hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: gmoney49
Reviews.Content: Smells like mold throughout the hotel and very slow service...Nothing to say good about this place.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING >>>>DISGUSTING>>>> avoid at all costs Pay whatever go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: kimmilil
Reviews.Content: The photos here are extremely deceptive.. the room was horrid smalled of mould and mothballs. linens were disgusting. Lock on backdoor was not working .had to sleep in a chair propped against it and the other old chair against the front door. Not a safe place tobe felt extremely innsecure Food was extremely overpriced and medioche at very best . 1 towel in bathroom hair dryer broken garbage all behind chair used to sleep in .overall extremely extremely foul .was very happy to leave in the early morning after driving 8.5 hours . NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY AT ANY HOLIDAY INN THIS EXPERIENCE HAS RUINED MY VIEW OF HOLIDAY INN . MORE LIKE HELLS INN.

Reviews.Title: “Great service staff”
Reviews.Author: wfrancis
Reviews.Content: I was booked through my agent. Looks like a small motel from outside but this is a large one when you go inside.The staff seem to be well trained and polite. One person even directed me to my room giving me lots of information on my way to room. This kind of service is very rare these days. Bar and restaurant was good. room is comfortable. Some sort of reno going but it did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: _Trixxy7_
Reviews.Content: We were severely delayed upon arrival in Montreal, and missed a connecting flight. Air Canada decided to put their guests up in this hotel. Personally, I would not wish this place upon a homeless person! Rooms were disgusting, service was terrible and check in took ages. Most other hotels can check you in withing a matter of minutes, however, this place took about 15 minutes per person. Upon receiving our keys, we made our way to our room (which took forever to find) and realized our keys did not work. After having them re-programmed a second time they still did not work. Even the manager couldn't open our room. Upon going back to the lobby, I realized that several people were complaining about the state of the rooms (cleanliness, decor, etc). Some rooms even had unmade beds, dirty towels on the floor and stained sheets. When the manager brought the crib to our room for our 11 month old son, I realized very fast that we would not be staying at this hotel. The crib mattress was filthy and they didn't even give us a sheet for it. We promptly left and found somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for layover”
Reviews.Author: Vinceott
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with the quality and how clean the rooms were. I was a bit worried after reading the comments on here. Great airport hotel. Nice pool and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Scarey comments; but great. Staff service is very good. They go the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: shirley070
Reviews.Content: I read some comments before going there as I was supposed to be there for my meetings booked by my company. This hotel is great. All the staff I came across were simply great. I heared some work going on late at 3pm it did not bother me at all. Food is good. Atrium is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice, avoid it”
Reviews.Author: gentil997
Reviews.Content: Lengthy check-in, hotel staff could not careless about customers. The Hotel is generally dirty and would need to be closed for several months for complete renovations. There are different odors throughout the hotel coming from an inappropriate pool area ventilation to lack general lack of cleanliness in the public areas. Food at the restaurant is bad, overcooked and cold. Room bathroom are inappropriate with mold around and over the bathtub. Upon arrival, room was at 12 degrees. Heating unit is much too noisy. You have to choose between sleeping or heating. No breakfast for early departure flights. If this is Holiday standards, then I will avoid Holiday Inn from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Extreme Caution”
Reviews.Author: Zingo44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to any holiday inn standard. My comments are as follows: -lengthy check in process during the late night hours -strong musty odour throughout the hotel -rooms are circa 1980 -toilet was very old -the room was approx. 3 degrees when we arrived -hallways to rooms are old and dirty On the upside the shuttle service was very prompt and the driver was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: verypicky-in-TO
Reviews.Content: It was only for one night, but I was worried after reading some of the reviews. I had asked for a room in the renovated area, but I needed two beds and there weren't any rooms in that area with two beds. When I arrived, I found the people at the front desk very friendly and helpful. In fact, because I am such a poor sleeper, I emphasized that I needed a quiet location. I was given a room overlooking the outdoor pool. Great place to be in the winter! The room was very clean and comfortable. True it could have used a quick paint job and a couple of floor tiles near the bathroom door were cracked. Other than that, the only negative was the split bathroom, which is more of an inconvenience than a problem. The atrium is beautiful, the business centre is free, and the parking very convenient. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value/accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MMTNorthVancouver
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we thought Holiday Inns had a standard across the country-NOT so. The front desk was friendly but the hotel was old and in disrepair. We had to lump our luggage to the second floor as we weren't directed to an elevator "hidden" in the pool area. We were directed through a poorly lit parking lot. The entrance we were directed to to get to our room was under construction and had no light. We groped our way to find our room and were exhausted carrying luggage up to the second floor. How disappointing to open the room door and find a "grottie" room. The grout in the bathroom was brown and yellow in many spots along the floor and it was just old and well worn. If I'd paid $50 for the night in a small out of the way community I might not have complained but at $124+ taxes a night and in a major city adjacent to the airport, I felt ripped off. Guess it could happen anywhere but I wasn't too thrilled to find a bed bug on the bed while packing up the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: shirleyboni
Reviews.Content: The hotel shuttle picked my husband and I up at the airport and we arrived at the hotel around 2.20 am after a flight from Vancouver. The check in was smooth, the front desk clerk was pleasant and helpful and provided us with a menu from a local restaurant that delivers until 4am as the restaurant and bar in the hotel weren't open. Even though we were given a floor plan and directions to our room at the check in counter we had a hard time finding it. When we eventually found it, the room was clean and comfortable with nice toiletries and we have no complaints whatsoever about it. It was also quiet and private. We ate chips from a vending machine because by then it was too late for a meal delivery and we decided we should eat a proper meal at the hotel restaurant in the morning instead as they advertised a great breakfast. We got up in the morning and went off to find the restaurant at around 11am. It was closed. We checked out of our room and asked where we could buy some food in the hotel. We were told that breakfast was over at 10.30am and that the restaurant was due to open again at noon, however, we should still be able to get a cup of coffee there. We had to literally beg the restaurant staff for coffee, as they kept insisting they were closed, but finally the manager relented and sent a waitress to fix us up with two cups of coffee. After much huffing and puffing and obviously extraordinary inconvenience to them they managed to provide us with two cups of coffee for which we were charged a total of 5 dollars. At noon, we returned to the restaurant to find it still closed. A family of four was waiting outside. The manager was abrupt and told us to come back later. We returned at 12.15 to find the family of four still patiently waiting outside the restaurant in front of the closed sign. They asked the manager if they could order room service instead of eating in the restaurant, and he snapped back that room service was not available at this time. By 12.30 the family of four had give up waiting and went off to order food for delivery. At 1.15 pm the restaurant was still closed. We also gave up and took a cab downtown. This is an airport hotel and unlike downtown Montreal, there are no restaurants within easy walking distance. Travelers are either arriving after a long flight or they are preparing for a long flight. Airlines no longer serve meals so before or after flying across the country cooped up in a sardine can, I think it would be reasonable to anticipate that guests would like to be able to obtain food at an airport hotel. The fact that there was no food avaiable at noon - in the middle of the day is in our opinion diagraceful. The hotel made no effort whatsoever to scrape up even somuch as a bowl of soup or sandwiches for its hungry guests. For this reason, we think the service in this hotel is an utter disgrace and wewould never stay here at this airport hotel ever again nor would we recomend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Holidayinnsucks_10
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It is a death trap. the rooms are not sign posted properly. If there was an emergency the fire department would not find your room. This is a 5 to 10 dollar a night room. DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE RECEPTION. There is no recourse from Holiday inn. They will not help you at all. There is mold and mildew everywhere.Be on the lookout for bed lice.

Reviews.Title: “Umm not bad for a stopover in YUL”
Reviews.Author: kgreen12
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as we were travelling out of montreal the mext morning .. the hotel was nice and clean and easy to find as it is off the highway ! BUT there is a midean in the middle of the road so it was a challenge to find out how to get over on the other side of the road as the hotel .. but once we figured it out it as good hotel had free parking and as a priorty club memeber i got a free beer at the bar , the pool area is nicely done but do to the live trees and stuff it smelt a bit weird , we parked out backas it was free and as i read in previous stays peoples cars were getting stolen but we havent had a problem overall a good overnight place to sit well waiting for a plane

Reviews.Title: “Family Value.”
Reviews.Author: Brooke2010Cornwall
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this hotel after reading reviews that ranged from very good to very bad. I called the hotel before reserving and told them about my concerns. The friendly front desk agent listened to my concerns about the bad reviews. She explained to me that although it was an older hotel, it was currently being renovated a little at a time. She told me I could look at my room before checking in and that if I was not satisfied, I could see another room. She told me about the indoor pool and outdoor pool. She also mentioned that kids eat all meals free. Parking is also free. The purpose of our travel was simply to give our kids a fun hotel experience for one night. This hotel was the perfect choice. Every staff member was polite and friendly. Upon arrival, I asked to look at my room first and the agent willing let me look at the room. We purchase our buffet breakfast upon check-in and saved a few dollars by purchasing it at check-in. There is a huge indoor atrium with beautiful tropical gardens , a large indoor pool (with a LIFE GUARD) and our only complaint about the pool is that the water was too cold...although the kids didn't seem to mind...they also supply life jackets! The outdoor pool is also large...has a lifeguard...lawn chairs and life jackets. The pools are not open at the same time, but they have good hours. They also have a pool table, ping pong, air hockey and some video games available. Our evening meal at the restaurant was pretty good. The kids ate for free so no complaints here. The breakfast buffet was good value for the money...lots of delicious fresh fruit, muffins, croissants etc., cheese, bread several hot food items, juice, coffee and more...again, the kids ate for free. The biggest downfall of this hotel is that it just doesn't feel spotlessly clean like some other hotels do. It wasn't gross or anything, but you could tell that it needed some upkeep in places and more cleaning. The renovated areas look beautiful and once it is all done, I think it will be excellent...let's hope the price doesn't go up! I guess you could ask for a renovated room or to be in the renovated area...it looked as though the 400 hallway was the nicest...we were in the 200 hallway. You can also get rooms that look into the atrium as opposed to looking outside...this is kind of neat but the rooms lack a bit of privacy because people can walk right past your window and look in unless the curtains are closed...very well! All in all, we were extremely happy with our stay. This is an excellent hotel for a family with young kids because there is lots to do right at the hotel...the location is not appropriate if you want to walk to stores etc. because it is an airport hotel. However, we wanted to stay put at the hotel from check-in to check-out the next day and for that purpose, this hotel was excellent value. We paid $119 for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJohns
Reviews.Content: This was a nightmare from day 1. I booked this via an online bidding site so was blind as to the hotel I was getting. However, once my "bid" was accepted, I found out the hotel and immediately started reading the reviews. Most of the reviews were negative, and although this worried me, I had bigger worries on my mind (a huge business meeting) and hoped for the best. Driving to the hotel was easy and the road, unlike the picture posted by another person, was smooth. I'm guessing that pic was taking during some repaving as entrance was easy to access via my GPS. Parking was ample and free. The hotel staff when I came in were fairly helpful, and the front entry of the hotel was nice. Lots of seating and big flat screen TV's to watch soccer on downtime. When I was given my room, I asked if any upgraded rooms were available. Normally, when I get a Holiday Inn via a bidding site, for an additional amount, I get their newest room available. Sadly, this was not possible but they did give me what was considered the best possible. room. Walking to my room, I was given a map and STILL got lost. The layout of the hotel is insane and a wast of space. I was getting frustrated carrying my samples, luggage and computer and lucky for me, a staff member saw this and showed me the correct location of my room. Thank you. Once at my room, I opened the door and true disapointment kicked in. Where do I begin? -bathroom had hair in tub (not hair from your head either) -washroom and sink are are two separate rooms, so how do you wash hands without touching door knob? -beds, VERY uncomfortable. I am 6"2 and 180...this bed was just bad. Second bed in my room was barely on its bed frame. -furnishings were old -A/C unit worked fine -the worst part were the HEAVY yellow water stains staring at me from the ceiling. It was disgusting and made me wonder how this hotel (or more aptly, MOTEL) can represent a Holiday Inn. i have been to many Holiday Inn's in the USA and Canada and this really took the prize of being the worst. I'm not a person that wants to complain, and have nothing bad to say about the staff. But the room is what I am concerned about and when carpets have stains, when ceilings are 30-40% covered with yellow stains, and even small things like having over priced items in your vending machines to squeeze another $1 or $2..its just sad. For a family, I can understand the whole budget and entertainment aspect. There was a pool with kids in it (indoor) and maybe that is who this might be for, a family on a budget trying to give something to their kids that they will cherish. But still, I'm sure its within budget to upgrade and come up to par with other hotels or simply take the Holiday Inn name off the front. Also, in my hallway, there was a bucket collecting rain from a leaking ceiling on the second floor. This was a very sad sight each time I walked to my car and back to my room. I would not recommend this hotel nor would repeat. And to be honest, I did not stay the 3rd night on my booking. Since I cannot get a refund, I took this as a loss and booked at another hotel down the road for my final night. I really need one good nights sleep so I can manage the 9hr drive back to my home. Think long and hard about booking here. Unless its a last resort, you might want to see what else can be had. We all want to save money, that was my intention anyway, but this stay made me realize that saving cash was nothing to be proud of when my back ached every morning. Oh, for eating, choices are limited...there is a place to eat inside the hotel, but outside, I could only find a Tim Hortons and Subway within a short driving distance. Access to Montreal core was VERY easy by car (not sure about subway access) and airport is down the road with their shuttle service. Internet was decent speed (free).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: coolusername
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just came back from a 1 day business/leisure trip to Montreal. The day trip ended up landing in the middle of Formula 1 and this hotel was the only place available in our price range that we could find. (travelocity gets the credit for getting us a cheap rate) We were pleasantly surprised to find such a relaxing, tropical space inside what looked like an ordinary Holiday Inn exterior. Very spacious room with everything we needed. The lobby had an amazing pool surrounded by trees designed to look like an outdoor courtyard. The staff were courteous- we asked to extend our check out and they kindly allowed us to extend it to 230pm with no charge. We ordered room service and it came promptly and was delicious. When we ran out of coffee (we like coffee) we asked a housekeeper to bring us some more- she was extremely kind and gave us plenty more. (no charge) The pool was great but we were in it for about 20 minutes before we were told that we had to get out and it was "booked for 3 pool parties for the rest of the day." That was unfortunate. Also the beautiful hot tub was broken. We used the lobby bar several times. I was a bit disappointed that at lunch time (1pm) we had to eat in the lobby because the restaurant was closed. (?). The bartender was kind though and the food not bad and fairly priced. All in all- we were only in Montreal for 24 hours and were happy with the hotel we chose to spend so much time in. Good value, lots of surprises and it was right off the highway to get into downtown. (About 15 minutes). It was also about 10-15 minutes away from the train station and the airport. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start?! Brown water coming out...”
Reviews.Author: nedw
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?! Brown water coming out of the sink, mildew stains,musty smells, sand paper sheets, lumpy mini pillows, tired breakfast buffet with old fruit, stained carpets. Might be the worst Holiday Inn ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with park n' fly package”
Reviews.Author: TESS1936
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on April 27, 2010 for one night and took the park 'n fly package so we could leave our vehicle there for 5 days rather than park at the airport. Our room was spacious and clean and we ordered room service which wasn't too bad at all. Priority club members also get a coupon for a free drink at the bar. The only thing we didn't like was that on a Tuesday night the pool and hot tub were already closed when we checked in at 6:30pm. We had no problems with the shuttle service to and from the airport and our vehicle was safe and sound when we arrived. Overall I would recommend this hotel for the park 'n fly package.

Reviews.Title: “surprised. Looks old from outside but the service of staff.......above all!”
Reviews.Author: raviaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel not knowing what to expect. Looked like a motel from outside, But when you go in; it is like a vacation destination with lots of tropical atmosphere. Above all the staff is very courteous, helpful and attentive to details. That fills the plate.

Reviews.Title: “Surpise, Felt like a Tropical Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse1959
Reviews.Content: This hotel was breath of fresh air. Although in a busy city and close to the airport it was s very tranquil setting when indoors. It has a lovely atrium area complete with birds, fish and running water. There were plenty of benches to sit and read on or to just people watch. The pool, hottub and restaurant/bar area were all central to each room so very little walking was required. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable with plenty of pillows. The food at the restaurant was excellent, with plenty of variety and reasonably priced for a family. Although cool and raining outside we felt like we were on vacation in the tropics instead of on business. We particularly enjoyed the pool with its warm water and lifeguard on duty for our children. The fitness area was adequate with the typical equipment and the golftron was a lot of fun as was the pool tables. All helped us relax after a day of business. There is even a reading.lending library just in case you need something to read. this hotel has free aiport shuttle and is close to the train station as well as the Metro. Shopping was available within a kilometer. the free overnight parking was a bonus. All in all I would return.

Reviews.Title: “You might like it, you might not. This is not a sure bet.”
Reviews.Author: Legaltranslator
Reviews.Content: This hotel will probably be OK for a short stay. The pool area is nicely decorated and the lobby is quite nice too. The shuttle to the airport is good. At least some of the rooms are quite spacious. Unfortunately, the restaurant's menu is very outdated, and the cooking is subpar. The entire restaurant should be completely reworked and the a la carte dinner menu completely changed. My actual room was quite large, but the bathroom was very old and small. It is essential that this property renovate its bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wont Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: advisetrip
Reviews.Content: Cheap, run down hotel. Smells of smoke everywhere. Noisy heater, very drafty rooms. Gym is like a sauna, sharing same room as pool. Had to change rooms a few times. Service was slow. For an extremely cheap rate maybe as a last resort but overall there are far better places to stay. Not even at the same level as other Holiday Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room”
Reviews.Author: CDOTR
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via hotwire.com and did not pay much. The room was huge, the bed super comfortable. This hotel is much larger than it looks from the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vickibar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Airport last month while visiting my parents in Montreal for their anniversary. We arrived Friday night, my daughters immediately loved the pool and games area with its tropical atmosphere. The restaurant even had a terrace overlooking the pool area. We liked it so much that Saturday we decided to have dinner at the hotel instead of a restaurant for my parent's anniversary.The food was very good and at a decent price. The rooms were nice and clean and the staff was very friendly. I will definetely stay there again on my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Different experience”
Reviews.Author: AdamCifa
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I spent a night at this hotel before leaving the next day for New Brunswick. We were taking the train so we decided to stay close to the train station which is just minutes away from the airport. We were surprised when we were walking to our rooms. It felt like we were on some Tropical island. Very cool, very different. We had a swim; the lifeguard was a nice guy, very helpful. Really nice staff, all in all. We would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the airport the next day”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: We booked this as we needed to drop our car off at the airport and catch a flight the next day. Location was fine. staff very nice. We had a nice room, comfy bed. The outside pool area was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: RonnieAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We really liked it here, there are two swimming pools, a fitness, and the shuttle service to the airport works very well. The food in the restaurant was very well, also a great vegatarian dish. We could relax here before our flight to Amsterdam and our room was near the swimming pool. Also the room had everything we needed, and the reception was very nice to us.

Reviews.Title: “First time there and last”
Reviews.Author: torontoholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights and had 2 rooms. The room that our teenagers stayed in was smelling awful, the coffee percolator was not working. Our room looked ok however it needs painting and the walls are dirty. When I mentioned this to the agent on duty when we checked out (that the room was smelly) he did not apologize at all, like it was normal. Perhaps the bar, restaurant and pool area look good but the rooms need to be spruced up. I will not return there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dkjjh
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on this site the night before our stay and almost ended up cancelling. I'm glad we didn't as this was one of the nicest hotel stays for us. We traveled with 2 families, 15 people in all. We were slightly nervous about what to expect, but just until we got there. The check in was effortless, our room was very nice. It faced the atrium, but there certainly wasn't any musty smell. The rooms, at least in this part of the hotel, seem to have gone through a recent reno. The atrium is beautiful - real tropical plants, birds, fish tank, games to play and places to just sit and enjoy. We ended up having dinner just after 8 o'clock and were very pleasantly surprised when our waiter told us that they will keep the pool open longer just so that we could still have our swim. I love that the hotel has a life guard - we travel quite a bit and I have never seen one in any other hotel. The pool was lovely, hot tub was not working, but it was not missed. The next morning we enjoyed a lovely breakfast and then a swim in the outdoor pool - water temperature was amazing. The staff were all wonderful, the place is clean and all in all this was a very enjoyable stop over. I was amazed at the room rates at this place. Would definitely stay there again should we end up in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: mykismet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Airport for 2 nights and attended a family group function in the dining room of the Holiday Inn. Restaurant staff were amazing and very accomodating. Although we had requested to hold our event on their "patio" the restaurant manager had indicated that it was unavailable as they had to get it ready for a later event. this actually didn't happen till much later after our group left, therefore we could have had use of it. Front desk is extremely slow. 3/4 people behind desk, but only one person can actually serve guests and he flies around trying to help everyone at the same time. took us about 15-20 minutes to check in. rooms are really outdated. need new paint and upgrading in bathrooms. really thin walls to adjoining rooms and hallway. corridors smell "smokey" even though we were in no smoking area. windows need cleaning low cost but low quality accomodations. rooms/hallways need to be cleaned, painted and updated. geat location if you need to do things in west end of Montreal. just off of highway which leads to downtown. close to malls and airport

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimmyOOttawa
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to airport. Cons: 1. An old style motel converted into a hotel by adding a new front section, putting a roof over the car park and adding a swimming pool and some plastic plants....sad!! 2. Sullen, grumpy and unhelpful staff. 3. Food barely passable, poor choice on the buffet, cold coffee. Ended up going to Le Bifteque across the highway for something decent the second night. 4. Close to railway marshalling yard...nothing beats being woken up during the night as trains are being put together for the following day. 5. Fixtures and fittings in the bathroom were hanging off. 6. No elevator although it seems they are putting one in. 7. At night the bar has no life, ended up going to the hotel next door for a few drinks, welcoming staff and warm atmoshpere.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned Business Traveler says STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: pablopedro
Reviews.Content: First of all the front desk personnel were not friendly or helpful. The parking lot was not plowed due to heavy snow. Terrrible ordeal trying to park and back out! My room heater was noisy and not working efficiently. The room was COLD. Was told that in the morning someone would take care of this. Cold air was seeping through all the heater fixtures! This was my worst hotel stay ever and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Why OH why didn't I listen??”
Reviews.Author: Slocker
Reviews.Content: In four words - 'do not stay here'. We arrived at 1205AM and I phoned and was told the shuttle was finished for the night. Paid 20.00 for a cab. There are a lot of other hotels, the Hampton, the new Loft (same price point), and the Hilton - its more but probably worth it. I am not a hotel snob and know you get what you pay for, but this hotel does not deliver in any sense. To the almost 45 minute wait to get checked in, (and to my amusement - other guests being given rooms twice with someone already sleeping in them!) then to be told -nowhere in the vicinity can I buy cigarettes - no the bar is closed (it was a Sat night) - no you cannot have shuttle for 6AM or 7AM or 730AM the next morning. Hence another 20.00 cab ride back. Got to the room - very very Motel 6 (although that would be better) but the bathroom was not cleaned probably. Really, for 100.00/night - I at least expect the [-] to be cleaned from the toilet bowl!!! I then decided I needed at least a can of coke. Two pop machines did not work - the one that did was out of coke. Thirty minutes later I decided I should be grateful for my can of Sprite. The decor is dated, the staff disorganized and to add injury to insult, the hotel is not even that close to the airport!! Heed my warnings - DO NOT STAY HERE - its a scum-pit!! Slocker

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: oceanson
Reviews.Content: The definition of a [--]. Smells bad , dirty , very cheap look to it , bad service. My door key needed to be reprogrammed each time I used it . And the frontdesk people would each time look very surprised that it did not work properly as if I was to blame for that. Do not confuse with the Holiday Inn Express which is down the road and appears to be a much better place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as abad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Priceline for 60$US all included, so around 75$CAN. I was really scared when I saw the ratings and was expecting the worse. The location itslef is pretty crummy, on Cote de Liesse, not close to any metro station, but by car, its about 20 minutes to downtown, and maybe 5 minutes to Namur Station (plenty of street parking). The area is industrial (well, this is an airport hotel).... The facility is definitely old school motel, 2 storeys, with 2 courtyards, one which has been covered for the jungle atrium seen in the hotels photos. A bit tacky but probably fun for the kids. This looks like it was last renovated in the 80s. Front service was friendly and attentive. A good portion of the hotel is being renovated. We ended in a renovated room with a confortable king bed (was supposed to get 2 double beds, but we checked inn late, so we managed to get a room with a king). The room was smallish, as any Holiday Inn, and the bathroom also, but it was clean and in good shape, with good shower pressure. Plastic glasses. Parking is free. A restaurant on premise offer a breakfast buffet for 12$CAN. Priority club members receive a free drink voucher for the bar. Overall, this was a decent room, in a typical airport environment. For people in transit, or people with car. Would come back again for a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed (if that's a word)”
Reviews.Author: Numbers_Guy70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business, needing a place near the airport. Wouldn't do it again. Hotel is dated (looks like a converted motel), bathroom fixtures and decor were very old, and no elevator to go to the second floor. Once I got to the second floor, it was a long distance walk to my room (at the back of the property). For the money, I would not stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: CarmenAlberta
Reviews.Content: After travelling for 7 weeks around Canada this was our final night before departing. Up until this time we'd had no problems with our accommodation. That was until we had people come into our room at 1:00am and then again at 1:30am looking for friends. These rooms are only accessible with a door key!! The hotel staff offered little in the way of sympathy or compensation for our ideal and my mum and I left the city disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling customer service - AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: LilacLou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when my flight to London was delayed. From the start the staff were unfriendly. Check in took ages, despite several staff members seemingly doing nothing behind the counter. The room itself was dingy, musty and old fashioned. The bar staff were incredibly rude - literally just shrugging when we asked them anything! My vegetarian pizza had ham over one corner of it which was the kind of sloppy attitude we experienced throughout the hotel. The receptionist was lazy and unhelpful. We overheard other guests complaining about their stay but again the staff just ignored them, their attitude was that nothing was their problem. Also - the hotel doesn't have a lift! How bizarre for an airport hotel when most guests will have lots of luggage! I would really recommend that you avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bad for a holiday inn. Our problems started at check inn. We arrived in Montreal after a trip to california from the UK. Our flight to london meant we had a 12 hour stop in Montreal. We called the Hotel from the airport and they agreed they had a room for the day for 4 adults and agreed a price. After a long wait for the shuttle bus we arrived to be told we couldnt have the 1 room but they only had 2. There was no apology or concern she was very rude and abrupt. She blamed the mis information on her colleague who was checking in another group. She then suggested if we wanted to argue we could deal with him. I agreed and said i would like to speak to the person i made the agreement with over the phone..not argue as i pointed out. I spoke to George who aske for our credit card and proceeded to check us in to the room and rates we agreed on the phone. She then decided to interrupt and pointed out that her colleague was making a mistake and shouldnt be giving us the rooms whilst she was serving another guest. her manner from the start was rude and it appeared she had issues with her colleague who remained very proffessional throughout. After this we found the rooms very dated and the whole place was unpleaseant. Im not one to complain but this was atrocious for a Holiday Inn. I expected a whole lot more for the prices they chrge. I will also be making a formal complaint against the female member of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smell horrible”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTravelcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel through an airline voucher when our flight was cancelled. I know the hotel was busy at that time, but the first room we were given had an overwhelmingly smoky and musky smell. The kind of smell that permeates everything and ferments over twenty years in the carpets, drapes, etc. We asked for a new room, but the second one was just as bad-smelling. On top of that, the check-in staff were rude, the bathroom was dirty and all our clothing stunk badly when we got home. I would say this is barely a two star hotel. Definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “car stolen from parking lot”
Reviews.Author: ForeverVacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a definite safety issue - a car was stolen from the parking lot in August 2008. Right near airport so very noisy. Unfourtunately this hotel is being marketed to US youth sports teams as an ideal place to stay during a tournament. - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: kateoz
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in Montreal for 1 night due to flight cancellations. I therefore needed to stay near the airport and was trying to find a room at 8pm. The Hilton and the Four Points Sheraton were both booked out but I thought Holiday Inn had a certain standard it had to live up to so I booked this for $130 including tax. The free shuttle from the airport to the hotel was appreciated. The service at the front desk was excellent and very friendly. However, the room was below average. There was hair in the sink and the toilet seat was not clean. TV reception wasn't clear. The rooms have 2 doors - 1 to a corridor and the other to the indoor pool, which meant a fairly noisy atmosphere. The rooms are tired and dated and in need of renovation. Additionally, the alarm clock was not set to the right time, which I would expect - it was 12 hours off and therefore looked as if it was the right time. Luckily I had set the alarm on my cell phone as well, or I would have missed my flight. If stuck at Montreal again, I'll find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0mesweeth0me
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very bad. The service at the front desk and in the restaurant is horrible. The room needed some renovation. They decided to close the pool at 7:00pm when it was supposed to close at 9:00pm. The parking is full of ice, it's very dangerous. There was a private party in the atrium till midnight, couldn't get to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: Candidly, I expect that I won't get a good room when I book on Priceline- but this hotel was horrible. Priceline had it at 3 stars- it was barely 2. This place is allegedly being renovated- and the room we stayed in needed it. There were mosquitos in the room- 30 or 40. (AND NO OPENING WINDOWS). The bathroom had black stains that had been caulked over multiple times. There was an access hatch in the ceiling and the plaster around it was rotting and falling. The Air conditioner sounded like a train- which was good because it masked the road noise with a consistant loud noise. The only pros- the sheets were very clean- and there was free wireless internet. They gave me a free drink- although I really needed 12 to make this place acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “This is more of a 2.3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CWipes
Reviews.Content: I'm upset about trip advisor not publishing my previous posting because it said I wrote to much about the surrounding city in additional to the hotel. That being said I'll keep this one short and leave out the photos. The hotel is undergoing major renovations to the majority of it's rooms. Stayed for a week. It's located about 4km from the airport, and 18km from downtown. I had no problems with parking and no one broke in to my vehicle. Booked via priceline, it was a good value but I'd give the current rating as 2.3 out of 5. You need to rent a car if you're going to be staying at this hotel. There is a free shuttle that goes to the airport every 30 minutes. There is also free wireless internet access. The mall which has a movie theater, and numerous dining choices is located about 5 minutes from the hotel, just north of 40, (don't get on 40) it's just north.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs - Do not Stay.”
Reviews.Author: FYI_from_SEA
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there one night. We booked two rooms as we have a rather large family. One of the rooms must have had bed bugs or something because those who slept in that bedroom had bug bites all over their faces and necks. To be honest and fair - we didn't actually see any bugs. The room with the bed bugs had a good shower. The other room the shower was damaged because the water dripped out slowly. So we all took showers in the room of with bed bugs. The hotel is being remodelled. In order to get to the main lobby, we had to walk through a hall way with tools and materials placed along the wall. Local phone calls are not free. Location is horrible. It was far from all of the major attractions that we visited. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel...no security”
Reviews.Author: kathyann66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when my daughter had a softball tournament in Montreal. For starters it was not very safe you did not need your key to swipe the doors to get in at all. Most of the doors to get in the hotel were broke. This was a big problem considering cars were being stolen and broken into from the property all day and night long. I did not feel safe at all especially having 3 teams of teenage girls there. Hotel was not clean. The best part of this hotel is what they show on line the indoor pool area. Food was terrible in this hotel. Hotel was booked and they had two waiters on in the Restaurant took 2hrs for our food and it was cold and nasty. Will never stay here again or Monteal Canda..by the time our group left we were there 3 nights we had 2 stolen cars, 1 laptop and 1 wallet stolen and 1 Car almost stolen theives were interrupted...This hotel and Montreal suck...

Reviews.Title: “Nasty and below expectations”
Reviews.Author: PapaGerald
Reviews.Content: We are long-time Priority Club members but will not be staying at anymore Holiday Inns that we are not already familiar with. The quality is too inconsistent. The carpet was soiled from a spill. The box spring had a visible soiled place. One pillow had an offensive odor. We received poor directions to our second floor room from the desk clerk and had a difficult time finding our room as we traveled with our luggage upstairs and downstairs (no elevator).

Reviews.Title: “the slowest check-in process ever”
Reviews.Author: Hickton
Reviews.Content: It took 20 minutes to check in at 10:00 on a Wednesday night. There were 2 people in front of me and just one person at the desk. During the next 20 minutes a queue rapidly formed behind me. The check-in clerk was having problems with the computer system. Frustratingly there were at least 4 people visible through the translucent glass in the office behind the desk. Nobody came to help. I found I had been allocated a smoking room despite requesting no-smoking. When at 11:30pm, I went back to the desk to get my room changed, it took another 20 minutes to get a non-smoking room. Apart from that, the accommodation was OK, the car park had plenty of space and it was really nice that the restaurant was open until 23:00

Reviews.Title: “beware of park`n fly !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: doudou40
Reviews.Content: I booked that hotel so i could leave my pick up at the hotel parking because i didn`t want to leave it at the airport. I was going away for 1 month. To my big surprise i thought that was weired that they did`nt want to keep my pick up keys!! They didn`t even want to have my license plate number. So when i got back from my wonderfull trip, my truck was GONE !!!! the hotel was no help at all and i will NEVER stay there again. The rooms are verry old and have a funny smell. The bar is open late so you can have a drink before leaving for your vacation out of Dorval airport. The cost of one beer is $6.00 plus tip, so we only had 2 !! loL Remember if you want to leave your car there with the park`n fly package, go somewhere else where they will take your keys and license plate number. I had to book another flight to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Pathetic Dump”
Reviews.Author: shakkazulu
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, DO NOT STAY HERE!!! This review is long and detailed, as I don't want anyone else to experience what we did. I will start off by saying that I am from Montreal, but now reside in Ottawa. My girlfriend and I were flying south for a week from Montreal, so our travel agent booked us here for one night. It seemed convenient, with free parking for up to 28 days with one night stay (this is too good to be true and I should have suspected something), and an airport shuttle service. In my opinion, this hotel is a fraud. Firstly, it is not an "airport" hotel. It is on Cote de Liesse near the Decarie expressway, which is a long way from the airport. To be exact, it is a $20 cab ride. I know this because their "shuttle service" is a joke and we had to get a taxi. Where to begin...We checked in and the extremely rude receptionist demanded the confirmation number, even though you would think a name would suffice. In any event, I went out to the car and retrieved the number. I then asked for a 6 a.m shuttle to the airport, and was told that it was full and that the next available shuttle was at 7 am. As our flight was leaving at 8:30 this was a little too tight. The lady at the desk seemed very unconcerned, and told me that since the weather was bad, the next day's flights were likely going to be delayed anyhow. Apparently during her breaks she moonlights as an air traffic controller. I asked how many spots they had on their "shuttle' and was told it is an outside service they use, and only 10 spots are available, and since this was a busy time of day for flights it was already full. Here's a clue...if it's a typically busy time, get more (or bigger) vehicles. Anyhow, I wanted to stay somewhere else but it was getting late and we just wanted to chill out, so I asked what the room rate was if we didn't leave our car there. My intention was to drive ourselves to a Park and Fly in the morning and use their shuttle. The rate I was quoted was higher than what I was already being charged. They know they have you, so they scam you into having to stay there. But the best was yet to come... We went to our "room"...I use this term loosely, because it was a dump. Plain and simple, a youth hostel would have been better. Old, tired and dank. I called the front desk and asked for a wake-up call at 6 am. "No problem". I also asked that a cab be called to attend the hotel at 6:30 and pick us up. Again, "No problem". Not trusting them, I set the alarm in the room (which had a battery backup in case of power failure, but no battery in it!) as well as my watch. No wakeup call ever came, and no cab was called (we called one ourselves). Everything, from the sheets to the towels to the carpets and furnishings, is unclean, worn out or both. At checkout, I complained to the typically inept clerk about the service and asked to see the manager, whose name was posted on the wall as "on duty'. Turns out he doesn't come in until noon, so I let the counter staff feel my frustration. As with the shuttle service and the wake-up call, he didn't work well either. So, to summarize, this is not an airport hotel. You are better off staying anywhere else. There are certain features an airport hotel should have, like a shuttle, a wake-up call and relative proximity to the airport. This place has none of the above. You almost need a connecting flight to get from here to the airport! It is not a Holiday Inn, but instead an independently run franchise operated by "Hotels Cote de Liesse" or something like that. Holiday Inn goes to great lengths to advertise this fact, as they know something we don't (yet). If there was a "zero star" rating possible I would give it to this joke of a building (I refuse to refer to it as a hotel). They have a clean and professional looking lobby, with a 4 star rating on the wall (that has to be fraud right there), but this is just the hook to get you to commit.
